intro: Paxiodendron usambarense, commonly known as the Usambara tea tree, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Tanzania. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and evergreen leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. It has a compact, shrub-like form with dense foliage. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
